JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Rajko Pirnat
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and live in GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , State Attorney General .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . The case concerns CARDINAL sets of administrative proceedings resulting from the applicants’ dissatisfaction with their neighbour ’s allegedly illegal construction of extensions to his house and various facilities . This construction is situated on their neighbour ’s plot of land which is separated from the applicants’ land by a public road .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants reported their neighbour ’s building of an extension to his house , a garage and certain facilities to ORG NORP za okolje in prostor DATE “ the ORG ” ) . The applicants disputed the legality of the construction and requested that proceedings be instituted against their neighbour .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicants learned that the ORG had not found any irregularities concerning the allegedly illegal construction . Subsequently , the applicants unsuccessfully appealed to ORG glavnega republiškega inšpektorja ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested that the proceedings be reopened .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged a claim with ORG sodišče ) on account of the ORG ’s failure to decide ( molk organa ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged a claim before ORG arguing that ORG okolje in prostor – “ the Ministry ” ) had also failed to decide .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested the proceedings to be joined .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE , the ORG ruled that under the law in force , the applicants did not have locus standi in the proceedings concerning the neighbour ’s construction work in spite of the fact that they had requested the ORG to act . These proceedings had been instituted by the ORG itself and only the initiator of the allegedly illegal construction had standing in the proceedings brought by the ORG against him .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged an appeal which was rejected by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants challenged the ORG ’s decision before ORG . At the same time , the applicants withdrew their previous claim lodged on DATE ( see paragraphs CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered a judgment rejecting the applicants’ claim . This decision was served on the applicants on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the applicants’ appeal . It quashed the ORG ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) and ordered the Ministry to re - examine the case . The judgment was based on ORG decision of DATE issued in the second set of proceedings ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) requiring the authorities to take into account the actual effect the ORG proceedings had on the particular complainant .
CARDINAL . On DATE , as a result of the ORG decision of DATE , the ORG quashed the ORG ’s decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) and ordered the Inspectorate to re - examine the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG , applying the criteria from ORG decision , again rejected the ORG request for recognition that they had locus standi in the proceedings . The ORG found that there was a public road between the applicants’ and their neighbour ’s plot of land . Hence , neither the applicants’ rights and obligations nor their legal interest could have been affected by the ORG proceedings conducted against their neighbour . In addition , the ORG found that the applicants’ neighbour had acquired the urban planning permit ( urbanistično potrdilo za gradnjo ) for the works concerned .
CARDINAL . The applicants appealed . The Ministry rejected their appeal on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants challenged the ORG ’s decision by bringing a claim before ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicants’ claim finding that the applicants had failed to demonstrate their legal interest , namely , in what way the ORG ’s measures might affect their rights , as required by ORG decision , and that they accordingly did not have standing .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the ORG instituted proceedings concerning the applicants’ neighbour ’s construction of a wall . On DATE the applicants proposed that proceedings be instituted also with respect to the landslip .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested an access to the case file and asked the ORG to secure certain evidence in connection to the landslip .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG issued a decision finding that they did not have locus standi in the proceedings and they could not be granted access to the file or make a request for evidence to be secured .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG rejected their appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants challenged the ORG ’s decision in ORG and requested that the present proceedings be joined with the first set of proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the ORG claim and request .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged a constitutional appeal with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a decision ( Up-CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) finding that when deciding on the applicants’ standing in proceedings instituted ex officio by the ORG , the authorities should have taken into account their legal interest , in particular , whether their rights were affected in these proceedings . It quashed the disputed decisions and remitted the case for re - examination by the ORG . This decision was served on the applicants on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants urged the ORG to decide in accordance with ORG ruling .

CARDINAL . It appears from the letter of ORG , ORG ( Ministrstvo za notranje zadeve , PERSON ) , sent to the applicants on DATE further to their prior complaint , that the ORG allowed them to examine the case file .

CARDINAL . NORP However , on DATE the ORG , relying on ORG decision , ruled that the applicants did not have locus standi in the ORG proceedings , finding that they were not the immediate neighbours since there was a public road between the CARDINAL plots of land . In addition , the ORG found that a potential landslip did not present any risk to the property of the applicants . As neither the applicants’ rights and obligations nor their legal interest could be affected by the ORG proceedings conducted against their neighbour , they could not be said to have standing .
CARDINAL . The applicants appealed to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG rejected their appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants challenged this decision and instituted proceedings before ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the ORG claim , finding that they had failed to demonstrate their legal interest , namely that the ORG ’s measures might affect their rights . As a result , ORG ruled that the applicants did not have standing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested permission to examine the case file from DATE concerning their neighbour ’s urban planning permit ( urbanistično potrdilo za gradnjo ) issued in respect of certain buildings on their neighbour ’s plot of land .
CARDINAL . On DATE the officer of ORG enota GPE ) orally informed the applicants that their request would be refused . No written decision was issued within the prescribed time - limit .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged an appeal to ORG against the oral decision refusing them access to the file .
CARDINAL . On DATE they lodged a claim with ORG on account of the ORG ’s failure to decide . In accordance with a change in the relevant legislation , ORG obtained jurisdiction in the case .
CARDINAL . However , on DATE , ORG issued a decision rejecting the ORG appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants extended the claim lodged on DATE to include also the ORG ’s decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the ORG ’s decision for procedural reasons and remitted the case for re - examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE , since no decision had been issued by ORG within the prescribed time - limit , the applicants requested ORG to give a ruling . ORG rejected their request as premature .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were asked to demonstrate their legal interest in the case . As a result , the applicants submitted ORG decision of DATE .
DATE . On DATE ORG , after re - examination , again rejected the applicants’ request to have access to the file since they had failed to demonstrate their legal interest in the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed to the Ministry .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Ministry rejected the appeal . The applicants did not lodge any claim against this decision to ORG . However , on DATE , they requested the Ministry to reopen the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE that request was rejected by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants’ neighbour lodged an application for a site development permit ( lokacijsko dovoljenje ) concerning the legalisation of extensions to his house and certain facilities built on his property . By virtue of the applicable domestic law , the applicants were a party to this set of proceedings .
CARDINAL . Hearings were held on DATE and DATE ; the applicants participated in these hearings .
CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicants requested that the relevant evidence in the proceedings be secured by ORG decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed to ORG on account of ORG failure to decide .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a decision rejecting the applicants’ request to secure evidence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against that decision to the Ministry .
CARDINAL . On DATE they urged the ORG to rule on their appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the first - instance decision of DATE and remitted the case for re - examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed to ORG on account of ORG failure to decide .

CARDINAL . In response to a letter of DATE in which the ORG requested an explanation , ORG informed the ORG that the decision quashing the first - instance decision ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) had never been served on them . Subsequently , ORG informed ORG that the decision had been served on them on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested the Ministry to urge ORG to decide on the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the ORG that the delays were due to the backlog of administrative cases . On DATE , finding the said reasons for delays unjustified , the Ministry ordered ORG to issue a decision within DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a site development permit which had the effect of legalising the relevant buildings and facilities .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed to the Ministry against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the first - instance decision and remitted the case for re - examination .
DATE . On DATE and on CARDINAL DATE CARDINAL hearings were held . Subsequently , ORG issued a new site development permit legalising the relevant buildings and facilities .
CARDINAL . The applicants appealed against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Ministry quashed the first - instance decision and remitted the case for re - examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the application for a site development permit lodged on DATE by the ORG neighbour . It appears that the neighbour did not appeal against this decision .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to section DATE of the DATE LAW ( Zakon o splošnem upravnem postopku , ORG no . CARDINAL ) , as in force at the material time , only a person having requested the institution of proceedings , a person against whom the proceedings were conducted or a person allowed to participate in the proceedings to protect his or her rights , was to be considered a party to proceedings .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provided that administrative proceedings might be instituted by the administrative authorities ex officio on the basis of law or when so required by the public interest . When instituting proceedings ex officio , the authorities were required to consider any request made by an individual or an organisation as well as any instructions of other authorities .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) provided that in simple matters , where there was no need to undertake a separate examination or there was no other reason which would prevent the authorities from deciding immediately , an administrative body was obliged to give a decision within DATE of the submission of the request for the institution of proceedings or the date on which the proceedings were instituted ex officio . In all other cases the administrative body was obliged to give a decision within DATE .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) entitled a party whose application had not been decided within the time allowed in sub - section CARDINAL to lodge an appeal as if the application had been denied .

DATE . Section CARDINAL of the DATE LAW ( Zakon o upravnem sporu , ORG no . CARDINAL /CARDINAL , entry into force DATE ) entitles a party having lodged an application with an administrative body to institute administrative proceedings before ORG ( administrative dispute ) in the following cases :

CARDINAL . If the appellate body does not rule on the applicant ’s appeal against the first - instance decision within DATE , or within a shorter period , if any , prescribed by law , and fails to make an award upon a subsequent request within a further period of DATE , the applicant may then bring an administrative action , as if his request had been dismissed .
CARDINAL . The applicant may also act in accordance with the preceding paragraph when an administrative body of the first - instance fails to give a decision from which no appeal lies .

CARDINAL . If in matters where a right to an appeal exists a body of the first instance fails to give a decision upon the individual ’s application within DATE , or within a shorter period , if any , prescribed by law , the individual may then submit his application to the appellate administrative body . Should the latter find against him , the individual may then bring an administrative action . The individual may also bring an administrative action under the conditions set out in paragraph CARDINAL . ”
